properties.headline: Mardi Gras Parade - Saturday 29 February - SYDNEY CBD TO MOORE PARK via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde
properties.publicTransport: Buses between the city and the east will be diverting and using different stops from 4.30pm while major roads are closed. Museum Station will be closed from 5pm until 4am for crowd safety. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Mardi Gras Parade Road Closure & Clearway map - Sat 29 Feb 2020
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Mardi Gras Parade Road Closure & Clearway map - Sat 29 Feb 2020

properties.otherAdvice:
Hundreds of thousands of spectators will line the streets to see the annual Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade travel from Hyde Park to Moore Park via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde from 7:30pm until around 11.30pm. Road closures and parking restrictions will be in place from as early as 3pm and most roads remain closed until 4am Sunday.

ROAD CLOSURES

From 3pm to 4am: Liverpool St between Elizabeth St and College St, sections of Campbell St and local roads in Surry Hills. Yurong Pkwy will close until 7pm. 

From 4.15pm to 6.30pm: College St southbound from St Marys Rd to William St.

From 4.30pm to 4am: Oxford St from College St to Darlinghurst Rd, College St from William St to Oxford St, Flinders St from Oxford St to Moore Park Rd and Anzac Pde southbound from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd including the Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde off-ramp (Bondi exit remains open). Sections of Wentworth Ave, Goulburn St, Crown St, Bourke St and various local roads off Oxford St and Flinders St will also close.

From 6pm to 4am: sections of South Dowling will be closed between Oxford St and Fitzroy St

From 6:30pm to 4am: Anzac Pde northbound from Lang Rd to Fitzroy St including the Eastern Distributor Anzac Pde on-ramp, sections of Moore Park Rd at Flinders St and Driver Ave.

From 9pm to 1am: sections of Elizabeth St, Castlereagh St and Pitt St between Market and Goulburn streets will close to allow crowds to safely leave the CBD. 

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the CBD and Moore Park and to expect delays as traffic will be heavy on detour routes.

Motorists travelling between the city and eastern suburbs will be diverted via Cleveland St in the south or via William St and Darlinghurst Rd in the north.  

Pedestrian access across the parade route will be maintained at Riley St, Crown St and Albion St from 4.30pm to 7pm, after such time there is no pedestrian crossing of Oxford or Flinders Streets available until roads reopen. 

Special event clearways will be in effect between 6am Saturday and 4am Sunday on various roads along and surrounding the parade route in the Sydney CBD, Surry Hills and Moore Park. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde

webLinks.linkText: Big Husky triathlon 2020 - Road closure listing and maps

properties.headline: Triathlon - Friday 28 February to Sunday 1 March - HUSKISSON Princes Hwy approaching Jervis Bay Rd and Island Point Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
More than 6,000 people will take part in the Ultimate Husky Triathlon held over 3 days from Friday 28 February to Sunday 1 March. On-road events start from 7am and finish by 5pm on Saturday and Sunday. Local roads will be closed on Friday with major closures in place on the weekend.

Access to Huskisson and Vincentia will be affected during the weekend while roads are closed and the event is underway.

Saturday: 

  • Road closures will be in place from 7am to 3:30pm on sections of Hawke St, Bowen St, Owen St, Sydney St and Tomerong St.
  • Access to Woollamia Rd from Tomerong St to Jervis Bay Rd will be restricted to residents and businesses only.
  • Access to Huskisson is via Huskisson Rd
  • Access to Vincentia is via Jervis Bay Rd and Naval College Rd.

Sunday: 

  • Road closures will be in place from 6am to 12:30pm on sections of Huskisson Rd, Woollamia Rd, Hawke St, Owen St, Currambene St, Seasongood Rd, Fairfax Rd, Knoll Pde and Sydney St.
  • Access to Huskisson and Vincentia is via Jervis Bay Rd/Naval College Rd only due to closures on Huskisson Rd from Tomerong St to Jervis Bay Rd.

Motorists are advised to expect delays and allow extra travel time through the area over the weekend.
properties.displayName: Triathlon - Friday 28 February to Sunday 1 March

roads.crossStreet: Jervis Bay Rd and Island Point Rd

properties.headline: Concert & Music Festival - Saturday 7 March - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Elton John concert tickets include travel on public transport. Ultra Music Festival tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes

properties.otherAdvice:
Around 40,000 people will attend events at venues in Parramatta including Elton John in concert at Bankwest Stadium with gates open from 5pm and Ultra Music Festival at neighbouring Parramatta Park from 1pm. 

Delays are expected along O'Connell St, George St, Church St, Victoria Rd, Parramatta Rd and Pennant Hills Rd approaching Parramatta and along Hawkesbury Rd and Park Ave around Westmead Station as crowds arrive at both venues throughout the afternoon.

Traffic will be particularly heavy in the evening from 10.30pm as both events finish around the same time and road closures will be in place.

Roads around Bankwest Stadium will close prior to the end of the concert and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists can detour around the closures in Parramatta via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd.

Roads around Westmead Station will also be busy as festival goers leave the park so motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.headline: Cricket - Thursday 5 March - MOORE PARK various roads incl Albion St, Moore Park Rd, Anzac Pde, Southern Cross Dr and Eastern Distributor approaching SCG
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Central to Moore Park walking & transport map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Central to Moore Park walking & transport map

properties.otherAdvice:
Women's T20 Cricket World Cup Semi Finals at the SCG from 3pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual along Anzac Pde, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd as crowds travel to the stadium.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads around Moore Park from midday until midnight.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones, that apply even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

MOORE PARK 

FROM MIDDAY UNTIL MIDNIGHT - THURSDAY 5 MARCH 2020

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Randle Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street (both Sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (both sides)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Poate Road and Regent Street (Taxis Excepted - southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Regent Street and Driver Ave (Buses Excepted - southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)

NOTES:

  • Existing clearways on Cleveland St between City Rd and South Dowling St are in effect from 6am to 7pm, seven days a week. On event days, these clearways will be extended to the times noted above.      
  • Driver Ave will also partially close before, during and after each event to help crowds move around the precinct safely.
  • Special event clearways will also be in place from 11pm Friday 28 February to 4am Sunday 1 March for the Sydney Mardi Gras Parade on various roads in the Sydney CBD, Darlinghurst, Surry Hills and Moore Park areas.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: various roads incl Albion St, Moore Park Rd, Anzac Pde, Southern Cross Dr and Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: Festival - Saturday 29 February - POKOLBIN McDonalds Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend A Day on the Green at Bimbadgen in the Hunter Valley from 3pm until 9:45pm. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Wine Country Dr, McDonalds Rd and Broke Rd approaching the site.

Fans using the Hunter Expressway can exit at the Branxton Interchange and use Wine Country Dr and then McDonalds Rd access the event.

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 29 February - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Rd at Turton Rd
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Newcastle Jets v Perth Glory at McDonald Jones Stadium from 5:15pm until 7:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as large crowds travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 8 March - GOSFORD Dane Dr between Central Coast Hwy AND Donnison St
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v  Wellington Phoenix at Central Coast Stadium from 4pm until 6pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than normal on the Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to the game.

Dane Dr between Georgiana Terrace and Donnison St will close from 2pm and re-open once crowds have safely cleared the area.

Motorists should be aware of changed traffic conditions in the area before, during and after the game and follow instructions of traffic controllers on site.

properties.headline: Music Festivals - Saturday 29 February & Sunday 1 March - WOLLONGONG Keira St, Burelli St approaching MacCabe Park
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 5,000 people are expected to attend music festivals on both Saturday and Sunday at MacCabe Park in Wollongong including the Farmer & the Owl from midday until 11pm on Saturday and A Sunny Afternoon from 12:30pm until 9:30pm on Sunday. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual along Keira St, Burelli St, Corrimal St, Crown St and the Princes Hwy as crowds arrive and leave over the weekend.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the park.
properties.displayName: Music Festivals - Saturday 29 February & Sunday 1 March

properties.headline: Festival - Saturday 7 March - CAMPERDOWN Parramatta Rd approaching Victoria Park
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Days Like This Festival at Victoria Park from 12pm until 10pm. 

Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area and exercise caution. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the park including Parramatta Rd, City Rd and Broadway.

properties.headline: T20 Women's World Cup Cricket Semi Finals - Thursday 5 March - MOORE PARK various roads incl Albion St, Moore Park Rd, Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor approaching The SCG
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
T20 Women's World Cup Semi Finals 1 and 2 at the SCG from 3pm until 9.45pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on roads approaching Moore Park including Anzac Pde, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd as crowds travel to and from the matches. 

Driver Ave will also be partially closed before, during and after the event.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads around Moore Park from 12pm midday until midnight.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

webLinks.linkText: Road to Recovery event routes & details

properties.headline: Community Cycle Ride - Saturday 29 February - KIAMA Princes Hwy, Illawarra Hwy, Moss Vale Rd - through Southern Highlands
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 100 riders will participate in The Road to Recovery fundraising cycle events starting in Coronation Park in Kiama at 7.30am with the 100km finishing at 2pm and 200km finishing at 5.30pm.

Cyclists will ride in groups of approximately 20 and be escorted by an event vehicle convoy. The 100km course travels from Kiama through Berry, Gerringong and returning to Kiama while the 200km course travels from Kiama through Robertson, Exeter, Wingello, Fitzroy Falls, Kangaroo Valley and finishing back in Kiama. 

Some delays are expected along the Illawarra Hwy, Moss Vale Rd and Princes Hwy during the course of each ride.

Motorists should exercise caution and are reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

roads.mainStreet: Princes Hwy, Illawarra Hwy, Moss Vale Rd

properties.headline: Street Parade - Saturday 29 February - WELLINGTON Mitchell Hwy / Nanima Cres between Maughan St AND Gisborne Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads will be closed for the annual Wellington Vintage Fair Street Parade along the Mitchell Hwy from 10am with large crowds are expected to attend.

Road closures

  • Mitchell Hwy and Nanima Crescent between Maughan St and Gisborne St from 10am until 11am.
  • Percy St between Maxwell St and Maughan St from 9am until 12pm approximately.

Light vehicles will be detoured via Gisborne St, Percy St, Warne St and Arthur St. 

Heavy vehicles will be detoured via Gisborne St, Thornton St and Maxwell St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow detour signage.

properties.headline: NRL Trial game - Saturday 29 February - GOSFORD Dane Dr between Central Coast Hwy AND Donnison St
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Knights Trial game at Central Coast Stadium from 7pm until 8.35pm. Preliminary games from 2.35pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on the Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to the game.

Dane Dr between Georgiana Terrace and Donnison St will close from 1.30pm and re-open once crowds have safely cleared the area.

Motorists should be aware of changed traffic conditions in the area before, during and after the game and follow instructions of traffic controllers on site.

webLinks.linkText: Cinema Under the Stars event details

properties.headline: Open Air Cinema - Friday 6 March - GOSFORD Dane Dr between Central Coast Hwy AND Donnison St at Central Coast Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Cinema Under the Stars - Lion King at Central Coast Stadium from 5.30pm to 10.30pm approx

Traffic may be heavier than normal on the Central Coast Hwy, Dane Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as attendees travel to the event during the busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should be aware increased pedestrian activity on roads around the stadium and exercise caution.

roads.secondLocation: Donnison St at Central Coast Stadium

properties.headline: Mardi Gras Grandstand installation - Friday 28 to Saturday 29 February - SURRY HILLS Flinders Street between South Dowling St AND Short St
properties.otherAdvice:
Lane closures and parking restrictions will be in place on sections of Flinders St on Friday night to allow for the installation of the parade grandstand ahead of the Mardi Gras Parade on Saturday night. 

Lane closures:

  • From 11pm Fri 28 Feb to 6am Sat 29 Feb - Lanes 1 and 2 northbound on Flinders St between South Dowling St and Short St
  • From 6am to 2pm Sat 29 Feb - Lane 1 northbound on Flinders St between South Dowling St and Short St
  • From 2pm to 4.30pm Sat 29 Feb - Lanes 1 and 2 northbound on Flinders St between South Dowling St and Short St
  • From 4.30pm Sat 29 Feb until 4am Sun 1 Mar - Flinders St will be fully closed in both directions for the Mardi Gras parade events starting from 7pm.

Special event clearways will be in effect on the western side of Flinders St between South Dowling St and Short St Fri 28 Feb to 4am Sun 1 March. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.
properties.displayName: Mardi Gras Grandstand installation - Friday 28 to Saturday 29 February

properties.headline: Music Festival - Saturday 21 March - SYDNEY CBD Art Gallery Rd, Mrs Macquaries Rd & Hospital Rd approaching The Domain
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 20,000 people are expected to attend the Download festival from 11am to 10pm at the Domain Sydney. 

From 8pm to 11pm Art Gallery Rd / Mrs Macquaries Rd will be closed.

From 9pm to 11pm sections of St Marys Rd, Prince Albert Rd, Hospital Rd and Cathedral St will be closed.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and use alternative routes while closures are in place.

arrangementElements.html:
SYDNEY CBD 

FROM 8PM TO 11PM

  • Art Gallery Rd will be closed to inbound traffic from Hospital Rd to Mrs Macquaries Rd
  • Mrs Macquaries Rd from Art Gallery Rd

FROM 9PM TO 11PM

  • St Marys Rd from Prince Albert Road to Sir John Young Crescent
  • Prince Albert Rd from Macquarie St to Art Gallery Rd
  • Hospital Rd from Art Gallery Rd to Shakespeare Pl
  • Cathedral St at St Marys Rd

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 14 March - KOGARAH Jubilee Ave, English St and Park St at Princes Hwy
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Perth Glory at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium from 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as large crowds travel to and from the stadium. 

Road closures will be in place before the game on the following roads around the stadium:

  • Jubilee Ave between the Princes Hwy and Park St
  • English St between the Princes Hwy and High St
  • Park St between Jubilee Ave and English St

Roads will re-open an hour after full-time or once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Wellington Phoenix at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium from 7:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as crowds travel to and from the stadium.

Road closures will be in place before the game on the following roads around the stadium:

  • Jubilee Ave between the Princes Hwy and Park St
  • English St between the Princes Hwy and High St
  • Park St between Jubilee Ave and English St

Roads will re-open an hour after full-time or once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 21 March - PARRAMATTA O'Connell St at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers FC v Sydney FC at Bankwest Stadium from 7:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as large crowds travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium may close prior to full-time and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and detour around the closures via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd instead to avoid delays.

properties.headline: Sydney Royal Easter Show - Friday 3 to Tuesday 14 April - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd
properties.publicTransport: ShowLink tickets include travel on public transport and extra trains and buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Sydney Royal Easter Show is expected to attract over 850,000 visitors to Sydney Olympic Park over 12 days from Friday 3 to Tuesday 14 April this year.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd approaching the precinct. Delays are expected particularly over the Easter long weekend from Friday 1 to Monday 13 when the Show is typically busiest.

Visitors driving to the event are urged to plan to arrive early and pre-book parking as car parks often reach capacity from the early morning.

Roads within the precinct will also be closed before, during and after the show including sections of Australia Ave, Dawn Fraser Ave and Olympic Boulevard.
properties.displayName: Sydney Royal Easter Show - Friday 3 to Tuesday 14 April

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd

properties.headline: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic - Sunday 29 March - TURRAMURRA, KUR-RING-GAI CHASE NATIONAL PARK, ST IVES Bobbin Head Rd, Mona Vale Rd
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic - Mona Vale Rd Clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic - Mona Vale Rd Clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 5,000 riders will participate in the annual Bobbin Head Cycle Classic in one of 4 events including a 104km, 80km, 57km or 27km course travelling from Turramurra through Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park and return. Events start from 6.30am.

Road and lane closures will be in place along the course at various locations and times between 5am and 3pm including sections of Karuah Rd, Turramurra Ave, Bobbin Head Rd, Warrimoo Ave, Woodbury Rd, Liberator General San Martin Drive, Old Pacific Hwy and Mona Vale Rd through Turramurra, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park, Mt Colah and St Ives.

Speed limit reductions will be in effect between 6:15am and 1:30pm along sections of Mona Vale Rd, West Head Rd, Bobbin Head Rd, McCarrs Creek Rd and Pacific Hwy.

Special event clearways will be in place along a section of the course in St Ives from 7am to 1:30pm on the eastern side of Mona Vale Rd from Property No.425 to Kitchener St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
TURRAMURRA

FROM 5:00AM TO 3:00PM

  • Karuah Road between Eastern Road and Turramurra Avenue (both directions)
  • Turramurra Avenue between Brentwood Avenue and Karuah Road (northbound)  

FROM 8:00AM TO 1.45PM

  • Bobbin Head Road at the intersection of Burns Road (Northbound right turn lane)  

KU-RING-GAI CHASE NATIONAL PARK

FROM 6:15AM TO 9:15AM

  • Bobbin Head Road* between the Park Gates at North Turramurra and the Park Gates at Mt Colah (northbound) * Detour via Mt Colah

FROM 7:30 AM TO 12:30PM

  • Liberator General San Martin Drive* between Cottage Point Road and West Head Road (northbound) * Access to Cottage Point unaffected 

TERREY HILLS

FROM 6.30AM TO 2.30PM

  • Mona Vale Road Left hand westbound lane at intersection of Myoora Rd/Forest way (Kerb Lane)

MOUNT COLAH

FROM 6:15AM TO 8:45AM

  • Old Pacific Highway approaching the intersection of Belmont Parade (kerb lanes in both directions)  

ST IVES

FROM 6:45AM TO 1:30PM

  • Warrimoo Avenue between Killeaton Street and Mungarra Avenue (northbound)

FROM 8:30AM TO 1:30PM

  • Woodbury Road between Mona Vale Road and Hume Avenue (eastbound)
  • Mona Vale Road approaching the intersection of Richmond Road (westbound kerb lane)
arrangementElements.title: Road and Lane Closures

arrangementElements.html:
The speed limit will be temporarily reduced for the safety of cyclists riding amongst vehicle traffic at the following locations and times. Speed limit reductions affects both directions unless stated otherwise.

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 90KM/H TO 60KM/H:

  • 7am to 10.45am - St Ives to Terrey Hills on the eastbound lanes of Mona Vale Road between Wildflower Gardens and Myoora Road
  • 8am to 1.45pm - Terrey Hills to St Ives on the westbound lanes of Mona Vale Road between Forest Way and the Wildflower Gardens      

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 80KM/H TO 60KM/H:

7am to 12pm - Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park

  • West Head Road eastbound between Liberator General San Martin Drive and West Head Picnic Area
  • West Head Road westbound between West Head Picnic Area and Liberator General San Martin Drive

6.30am to 8.30am - Mount Colah eastbound lanes of Bobbin Head Road from the Park Gates to Kalkari Visitor Centre

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 60KM/H TO 40KM/H:

  • 6.15am to 8.45am - Mount Colah, both directions on the Pacific Highway between Pacific Highway and Belmont Parade
  • 7.30am to 10.45am - Terrey Hills in both directions on McCarr’s Creek Road between West Head Road and Liberator General San Martin Drive
arrangementElements.title: Speed Limit Reductions

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than normal on Griffiths Rd, Turton and Lambton Rd, particularly during Friday afternoon peak.

As crowds travel to and from the show over the weekend motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Community walk - Saturday 29 February - SCONE New England Hwy Bypass at St Aubins St
properties.publicTransport: Scone train station is within short walking distance. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The New England Highway bypass at Scone will be open to the public for a community walk from 9am to 12pm on Saturday 29 February before the bypass opens to traffic. A ceremony to officially open the bypass will start from 9am.

Entry to the walk will be via St Aubins St which will be open to pedestrians only. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads in the area as visitors travel to and from event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.
